sources.title: The Non Stop Kid (1918) Directed By Gilbert Pratt
sources.description: The Non-Stop Kid Directed by Gilbert Pratt Written by H.M. Walker Produced by Hal Roach Starring Harold Lloyd Cinematography Walter Lundin Release date May 12, 1918 Running time 12 minutes Country United States Languages Silent English intertitles The Non-Stop Kid is a 1918 American short comedy film featuring Harold Lloyd . [ 1 ] Plot Bebe plays a pretty young thing with several suitors, including Harold, competing to win her affections. Cast Harold Lloyd as Harold Snub Pollard as Snub, the butler (as Harry Pollard) Bebe Daniels as Miss Wiggle William Blaisdell as Bebe's father Sammy Brooks as Short bearded man Billy Fay as Prof. Fay William Gillespie (unconfirmed) Lew Harvey (unconfirmed) Bud Jamison (unconfirmed) Margaret Joslin (unconfirmed) Gus Leonard as Old man at party J. Darcie 'Foxy' Lloyd (as James Darsie Lloyd) Charles Stevenson (unconfirmed) Dorothea Wolbert (unconfirmed) Noah Young (unconfirmed) References 1 The Non-Stop Kid at silentera.com From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

metadata.Plot: The popular young Miss Wiggle has many upper-class suitors, but she prefers Harold to any of them. Her father, though, chases Harold away, because he is arranging for his daughter to marry Professor Noodle. When Harold learns this, he intercepts the Professor on his way to tea at the Wiggles' house, and he then impersonates the Professor.
